item.title: Open Help Browser
item.description: Press Help/Help contents to open the help browser

item.title: Simple search
item.description: In the Search entry field enter the word "participation" without the double quotes. The navigation frame should turn to the Search Results view, and if this was the first time you search the docs, you should see the indexing progress monitor in that page. When indexing is finished (or right away if other searches were performed before) you should get the results.

item.title: Select result
item.description: Select a search result: "Workspace save participation". You should see the "participation" string highlighted, as well as "particip". This is because the search engine uses word stemming on English, so the highlighting respects the same stemming algorithm.

item.title: Highlighting Button
item.description: Test that highlighting can be turned on and off

subitem.label: Verify that there is an enabled button "Highlight search items"
Turn off highlighting by pressing the button.
Turn on highlighting by pressing the button again.

item.title: Open result
item.description: Click on two other results. You should see the page for each result open.

subitem.label: With one of the pages corresponding to a search result open press "Show in table of contents" and verify that the TOC shows and the correct item is highlighted.
In the TOC select the parent of the highlighted element

Press the button that looks like a flashlight, select "search selected topic and all subtopics" from the dropdown menu and verify that a dialog opens.opic and all subtopics" and verify that a dialog opens.
Verify that the input is set to "participation" and hit "OK"
Verify that the search resutls are redisplayed and that there are far fewer results which include the page that is currently displayed.

item.title: Narrow Search
item.description: Let's narrow the results by book.

subitem.label: Click on the "Scope" link in the search bar. This should launch the Select Scope Search dialog that let's use define search list.
Click on "New" to launch the dialog for defining a new search list.
Enter the name "workbench" and select the "Workbench User Guide", click OK to close the dialog.
The name "workbench" should now be visible in the list in the Select Scope Search dialog. Select it, and click OK (or double click instead).

item.title: Check search scope
item.description: The dialog should be closed and the Search Scope should now display the name "workbench". Note: Sometimes the search bar is not updated right away, so you may have to wait a bit.

item.title: Check Toc is Filtered
item.description: Click on the contents tab to show the table of contents. Verify that only one book, "Workbench User Guide" shows.

item.title: Search again
item.description: Search again for the same word, "participation". You should see fewer results than were returned by the unscoped search.

item.title: Select an item
item.description: Select the "Minimizing data loss from crashes" hit, and click on the "Show in table of contents" button on the navigation or content toolbar. This should switch the navigation view to the Contents view, and expand the Workbench User Guide down to the "Minimizing data loss from crashes" topic.

item.title: Redisplay search results
item.description: Click the "Search Results" tab at the bottom of the navigation tree. This should redisplay the search result you've seen in "Search Again"

item.title: Show TOC
item.description: Click on the "Contents" tab at the bottom of the navigation tree. This should redisplay the navigation tree as you left it before switching to the search results tab.

item.title: Show all
item.description: Click on "Scope" and in the scope dialog select the radio button "Show All"
